bibl.title: Polyeideia. The Iambi of Callimachus and the Archaic Iambic Tradition.
bibl.note: Introduction. - 1. Callimachus and the Adaptation of Hipponax: Iambus 1. - 2. On Not Going to Ephesus: Iambus 13. - 2. The Elevated Paradigm: Iambi 12 and 1 (lines 32-77). - 4. Fable: Iambi 2 and 4. - 5. Ethical Behavior: Iambi 3 and 5. - 6. The Statues: Iambi 6, 7 and 9. - Select Bibliography. Indices.
bibl.seg: ACOSTA-HUGHES Benjamin, Polyeideia. The Iambi of Callimachus and the Archaic Iambic Tradition. (Hellenistic Culture and Society. 35.)
Berkeley - Los Angeles - London, University of California Press, 2002, 8Â°, xv-351 pp. ISBN 0-520-22960-9. $65.

Introduction. - 1. Callimachus and the Adaptation of Hipponax: Iambus 1. - 2. On Not Going to Ephesus: Iambus 13. - 2. The Elevated Paradigm: Iambi 12 and 1 (lines 32-77). - 4. Fable: Iambi 2 and 4. - 5. Ethical Behavior: Iambi 3 and 5. - 6. The Statues: Iambi 6, 7 and 9. - Select Bibliography. Indices.

C.R. par Dee L. Clayman, CW 98 (2004) pp. 112-113. - Sandrine Coin-Longeray, AntCl 73 (2004) pp. 332-333. - Annette Harder, CP 98 (2003) pp. 394-398. - Mary Depew, CR N.S., 55 (2005) pp. 456-458. - A.D. Morrisson, Hermathena 175 (2003) pp. 95-98. - Frank Nisetich, IJCT 10 (2003-2004) No. 1, pp. 85-99. - Heather White, Myrtia 19 (2004) pp. 188-190.
